
#Removing invariant sites\
##Silvia Justi\
##9/18/2017\


Using phrynomics to remove invariant sites from SNP alignments.\
Install and load the following packages
```{r}
#install.packages("devtools")
#devtools::install_github("bbanbury/phrynomics")
library(phrynomics)
```


Sample names must have 9 or less characters\
Input must look like this\
Read your formated alignment
```{r}
snpdata <-ReadSNP("input_file.txt")
head(snpdata, n=10)
summary(snpdata)
```

Removing invariant sites
```{r}
only_variants <-RemoveInvariantSites(snpdata)
summary(only_variants)
```

Write your output to phylip format
```{r}
WriteSNP(only_variants, file = "only_var.phy", format = "phylip", missing = "N")
```
